comments.content: Renko, Thank you very much for the help.

I know it sounds peeky and my intention is clearly not to contradict Renko. Gotham is definitely a very good call but I rather think it's Mark Simonson's [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20150323000411/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/proxima-nova). Gotham glyphs are a bit larger. Having a look to [more samples](http://web.archive.org/web/20150323000411/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fwww.google.com/search%3Fq%3D100%2Bdays%2Bof%2Blove%2526safe%3Doff%2526hl%3Den%2526source%3Dlnms%2526tbm%3Disch%2526sa%3DX%2526ei%3DdvcLVYmpAYj1apfxgegD%2526ved%3D0CAcQ_AUoAQ%2526biw%3D1920%2526bih%3D1061%2523q%3D100%2Bdays%2Bof%2Blove%2526safe%3Doff%2526hl%3Den%2526tbm%3Disch%2526tbs%3Disz%3Al) (mainly [this one](http://web.archive.org/web/20150323000411/http:/www.kerala9.com/images/wallpaper/100-days-of-love/100-days-of-love-malayalam-movie-wallpapers-hd63.jpg)) confirms it for me (/M for sure).
You are right Ryuk, the E, too, fits perfectly in Proxima Nova.
Thank you both Ryuk and Renko!!! Excellent findings !!!
